0.body: Hush Line is a network of organizations and individuals who help whistleblowers and provides tip lines for secure and anonymous communication. ecosystem-diagram If you need a confidential reporting systemâ€”lawyers, journalists, employers, educators, or moreâ€”you can create a free account, and when you add an encryption key, you can start receiving secure messages!
0.breadcrumbs: Intro Â» Welcome to Hush Line
0.title: Welcome to Hush Line

1.body: Hush Line is intended to be a background service for you - add your key, then forward your messages to your desired email address, and never have to worry about logging back into the Hush Line platform again. We recommend using Proton Mail since we're built on the same encryption technology - PGP or Pretty Good Privacy . PGP is an open protocol providing strong encryption that's been around for decades and is trusted by governments and activists alike. When you use Proton Mail as described below, your anonymous Hush Line messages will be automatically delivered to and decrypted in your Inbox - no logging back into the Hush Line platform necessary. And since your messages are encrypted with a key to which only you have access, they are unreadable to anyone but you ðŸ’ª.
1.breadcrumbs: Getting Started Â» Getting Started with Hush Line
1.title: Getting Started with Hush Line

3.body: Step 1: Sign up for Hush Line & Proton Go to hushline.app and proton.me and sign up for your accounts if you haven't already. step1 Step 2: Import Your Key In your Hush Line settings, navigate to theÂ Email & EncryptionÂ tab. You'll notice that email forwarding is disabled until you add an encryption key. In theÂ Message EncryptionÂ section, you'll see a Proton key search input. To import your key, add the email address you just created. step2 Step 3: Mail Forwarding Now that you've added your PGP key from Proton you can add a forwarding address. Add your Proton email address. step3 Step 4: Send a Message Click onÂ ProfileÂ in the Hush Line global navigation. Enter a message into your form, and when you submit it, you'll see it encrypted in your browser before it sends - this ensures your message is end-to-end encrypted! step4 Step 5: Check Your Email Go back to your Proton account and, if necessary, refresh your Inbox. You should see an email fromÂ notifications@hushline.app appear. Click on it, and you'll see your automatically decrypted message! If you go back to Hush Line and clickÂ Inbox,Â you'll see the same message, but it'll be encrypted and unreadable since your key to decrypt the message only exists on Proton. step5 ðŸŽ‰ Congratulations, you're ready to start receiving encrypted and anonymous Hush Line messages!
3.title: Option 1: Proton

4.body: Step 1: Get the Extension To set up Mailvelope for Chrome or Firefox, follow the instructions found here: https://mailvelope.com/en/help Step 2: Create a key In the Setup dashboard, click on the "Generate key" button. Add a name for your key, your email address, and a strong password. Before clicking "Generate," click on the "Advanced" button. In the Algorithm picklist, choose "ECC - Curve25519". This algorithm is more efficient than traditional RSA encryption while providing a similar level of security. Now, generate your key! Once your key is created, click on it from the dashboard, then select "Export" in the "Public" tab and "Copy to clipboard." Select the Email & Encryption tab in your Hush Line settings, and paste your key into the Public PGP Key textarea. step2 Step 3: Authorize the Hush Line domain With Hush Line open, click the Mailvelope icon and select "Authorize this domain." Click "Ok" when the dialog opens. You'll be able to see tips.hushline.app in the authorized domains list. step3 Step 4: Send and read a message! Let's send a test message! In the header, click "Profile." Enter some text and click "Send Message." If you haven't disabled JavaScript, you'll see it encrypted in the browser before it submits. step4 Go to "Inbox" to see the message in the app. You may have to enter the password you set when creating your key in Mailvelope. step4_2 ðŸŽ‰ Congratulations, you're ready to start receiving encrypted and anonymous Hush Line messages!
4.title: Option 2: Mailvelope
